speaker: Julia
text: Hey, just checking in — has the API documentation been finalized?
ipa: heɪ, dʒəst ˈʧɛkɪŋ ɪn — hæz ði ˌeɪ.piːˈaɪ ˌdɒkjʊmɛnˈteɪʃən bɪn ˈfaɪnəlaɪzd?
linking: "checking in" → /ˈʧɛkɪŋ ɪn/ (ŋ + ɪ linking), "has the" → /hæz ði/ (z + ð linking)

speaker: Mark
text: Almost. The structure was approved last week, and the diagrams are being reviewed now by the client.
ipa: ˈɔːlməʊst. ðə ˈstrʌkʧə wəz əˈpruːvd lɑːst wiːk, ənd ðə ˈdaɪəɡræmz ə ˈbiːɪŋ rɪˈvjuːd naʊ baɪ ðə ˈklaɪənt.
linking: "being reviewed" → /ˈbiːɪŋ rɪˈvjuːd/ (ŋ + r linking), "now by" → /naʊ baɪ/ (w + b linking)

speaker: Julia
text: Great. And the PDF version — has that been shared with them yet?
ipa: ɡreɪt. ənd ðə ˌpiː.diːˈɛf ˈvɜːʒən — hæz ðæt bɪn ʃeəd wɪð ðəm jɛt?
linking: "shared with" → /ʃeəd wɪð/ (d + w linking), "with them" → /wɪð ðəm/ (ð + ð linking)

speaker: Mark
text: Not yet. It’ll be exported and sent once the final comments are incorporated.
ipa: nɒt jɛt. ˈɪtl bi ɪkˈspɔːtɪd ənd sɛnt wʌns ðə ˈfaɪnəl ˈkɒments ə ɪnˈkɔːpəreɪtɪd.
linking: "be exported" → /bi ɪkˈspɔːtɪd/ (i + ɪ linking), "and sent" → /ənd sɛnt/ (d + s linking)

speaker: Julia
text: Makes sense. I heard the security audit report was requested by their legal team. Has that been handled?
ipa: meɪks sɛns. aɪ hɜːd ðə sɪˈkjʊərɪti ˈɔːdɪt rɪˈpɔːt wəz rɪˈkwɛstɪd baɪ ðɛə ˈliːɡəl tiːm. hæz ðæt bɪn ˈhændəld?
linking: "audit report" → /ˈɔːdɪt rɪˈpɔːt/ (t + r linking), "been handled" → /bɪn ˈhændəld/ (n + h linking)

speaker: Mark
text: Yes, it was delivered yesterday. The encryption protocols were outlined clearly, and no objections have been raised so far.
ipa: jɛs, ɪt wəz dɪˈlɪvəd ˈjɛstədeɪ. ði ɪnˈkrɪpʃən ˈprəʊtəkɒlz wɜː ˈaʊtlaɪnd ˈklɪəli, ənd nəʊ əbˈʤɛkʃənz həv bɪn reɪzd səʊ fɑː.
linking: "were outlined" → /wɜː ˈaʊtlaɪnd/ (r + a linking), "have been" → /həv bɪn/ (v + b linking)

speaker: Julia
text: That’s a relief. Also, can you make sure the glossary is included in the final doc package?
ipa: ðæts ə rɪˈliːf. ˈɔːlsəʊ, kæn juː meɪk ʃʊə ðə ˈɡlɒsəri ɪz ɪnˈkluːdɪd ɪn ðə ˈfaɪnəl dɒk ˈpækɪdʒ?
linking: "make sure" → /meɪk ʃʊə/ (k + ʃ linking), "is included" → /ɪz ɪnˈkluːdɪd/ (z + ɪ linking)

speaker: Mark
text: Absolutely. It’s already been prepared and will be appended to the end of the main file.
ipa: ˈæbsəluːtli. ɪts ɔːlˈrɛdi bɪn prɪˈpeəd ənd wɪl bi əˈpɛndɪd tuː ði ɛnd əv ðə meɪn faɪl.
linking: "been prepared" → /bɪn prɪˈpeəd/ (n + p linking), "will be" → /wɪl bi/ (l + b linking)

speaker: Julia
text: Perfect. Once the doc is submitted, I’ll follow up with them to confirm everything was received properly.
ipa: ˈpɜːfɪkt. wʌns ðə dɒk ɪz səbˈmɪtɪd, aɪl ˈfɒləʊ ʌp wɪð ðɛm tuː kənˈfɜːm ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ wəz rɪˈsiːvd ˈprɒpəli.
linking: "follow up" → /ˈfɒləʊ ʌp/ (w + ʌ linking), "was received" → /wəz rɪˈsiːvd/ (z + r linking)

speaker: Mark
text: Got it. Everything should be wrapped up by EOD.
ipa: ɡɒt ɪt. ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ ʃʊd bi ræpt ʌp baɪ ˌiː.oʊˈdiː.
linking: "should be" → /ʃʊd bi/ (d + b linking), "wrapped up" → /ræpt ʌp/ (t + ʌ linking)
